p: Approximately 17 million patients have access to antiretroviral therapy capable of controlling viremia and reducing mortality [ 61]. However, long-term treatment with antiretroviral agents can lead to drug resistance due to rapid mutations in the viral genome resulting in RT mutations and HIV chemotherapy failure [ 62]. These concerns have attracted a particular focus on research into new antiretroviral drugs that address the limitations of currently available agents for the treatment of HIV infection [ 46, 59].
